meanings.definition: Something added to complete a thing, make up for a deficiency, or extend or strengthen the whole.
meanings.sent1: She takes a daily supplement to stay healthy.
meanings.sent2: The vitamin supplement helped improve her energy levels.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his love for ice cream was his essential supplement to happiness.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a supplement of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The colorful illustrations were a delightful supplement to the story.

meanings.definition: A section added to a book or document to give further information or to correct errors.
meanings.sent1: The supplement at the end of the textbook contained useful charts.
meanings.sent2: The magazine included a special supplement with bonus content.
meanings.sent3: The extra supplement in the manual clarified confusing instructions.
meanings.sent4: Her notes were a helpful supplement to the main text.
meanings.sent5: The appendix served as a valuable supplement to the research paper.

meanings.definition: To add an extra element or amount to.
meanings.sent1: She decided to supplement her income by taking on a part-time job.
meanings.sent2: He likes to supplement his diet with protein shakes.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to supplement the dish with a unique garnish.
meanings.sent4: Adding fresh herbs can supplement the flavor of the soup.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold colors to supplement the painting's impact.
